author: chris-dollin
msg: createGraph and openGraph now default to being "non-strict", ie, create
will open an existing graph and open will create a new graph. Both of them
take an optional boolean second argument `strict` which allows them to be
used strictly, ie strict create will throw an exception if the graph
already exists, strict open will throw an exception if it doesn't.
hasGraph(String name) returns true if there's a graph with that name
(approximately). [IE I punted on the work required for FileGraph when
the underlying file exists but isn't any form of RDF.]

author: ian_dickinson
msg: Added remaining restriction types and changed implementation factories
to throw ConversionException if the conversion is not valid

author: andy_seaborne
msg: Dublinc Core update : now for DC 1.1
